answers.answer: I think there is enough technology now to save a baby that early. I know for sure some babies can be saved at 29w. When I had my hospital tour they had a baby in the nicu that was born at 29w and he was doing great but with help of course.

24 years ago my cousin was born at 24 weeks. He had a rare birth defect where bis esophagus was connected toungs not stomach and had 14 asthma attacks immediately after birth. He weight about 1lb. Had to have surgery immediately and was in nicu for about 3 months I believe. Sry we are only two months apart so ik what ik from memory of being told lol. Anyways well be 25 next year and hes very healthy and getting on fine :-)
I'm high risk and my dr said my baby has a 50% survival rate at 24wks but it goes up to 95% by 28wks so I'm resting up and trying my best to get to the 28wk milestone. Good luck!
Yeah , 20 Weeks && Up A Baby Is Capable Of Surviving Outside The Womb With A Lot Of Help && Care .

Yes. And no..it just will need alotnof medical help..and will need a stay in the nicu....but theres alot more of a chance that something could go.wrong at that age.But theres a good chance it wouls.b fine

My sister delivered my nephew at 26 weeks and he only lived 10 days :/ she had preeclampsia. But, my cousin's wife just had her son last Thursday at 29 weeks and he is off the ventilator and doing well. The doctor told us that the longer you postpone the delivery the better for the baby. Unfortunately my sister's organs were shutting down and it was either she died or she delivered.Best of luck though! It is possible to survive outside at 26 weeks, but the chances are low. A big problem is breathing because their lungs aren't developed.

question: If It Were Ever To Happing That For Some Reason My Body Went Into Labor Or Something Happens While Pregnant Can The Baby Survive Outside The Whom at 26 Weeks And Up I'm Just Curious There's Nothing Wrong With Me But Just Wanted To Know ?
title: Born Early ?
